Key Arguments: The legislation violates free speech rights by giving ACMA the power to determine truth.
The bill exempts politicians from its regulations, which is seen as unfair and undemocratic.
Social media platforms should remain free from government interference except for upholding historically accepted free speech rights.
The bill could lead to greater incivility and national unrest.
The government should derive its powers from the consent of the governed, and this bill undermines that principle.
Notable Quotes: This Bill is outrageously proposing to empower ACMA to undemocratically and un-civilly interfere with our God-given rights to free speech.
All Australians should be free to speak truth to power, not merely one agencyâ€™s self-determined truth.
The inevitable result of seeking to control and oppress the opinions and speech of those in civil society who differ from their Government of the day, is tyranny, calamity and ruin.
